snippet: David Axelrod says that if President Obama wins a second term, the administration would consider ways to undo the effects of the Supreme Court's Citizens United ruling, which allows unlimited campaign spending by corporations and unions.
abstract: David Axelrod says that if President Obama wins a second term, the administration would consider ways to undo the effects of the Supreme Court's Citizens United ruling, which allows unlimited campaign spending by corporations and unions.

headline.main: Axelrod Floats Amendment to Stem Campaign Spending

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
